CoreAVC vs ffdshow?? Which one has better quality in x264 and DivX?

@Wiltsu-boy :
CoreAVC is THE way for x264, believe us.
No. Better than that, test it for yourself.
Go to the CCCP site and see the documentation about it.
And for DivX, i go for ffdshow.
Besides, thanks for the upload, aoloffline.

@groottenn

Should I use MPC or MPC Home Cinema or what player? Currently im using MPC Home Cinema.
Oh, and is high bitrate in video good? Like in audio, higher is better.

@Wiltsu-boy :
Yep, stick with MPC Home Cinema. I always use the latest Combined Community Codec Pack (right now  i'm using their very latest beta), and i know MPC HC is stable, reliable and has way more options than regular MPC to deal with video playback.
I suggest you check this two :
Extremely helpful info (even if you're not user of CCCP) : http://www.cccp-project.net/wiki/index.php?title=FAQ and :
The home of MPC HC :
http://mpc-hc.sourceforge.net/
or MPC HC support : http://sourceforge.net/apps/trac/mpc-hc/report/9
And the second, of course, higher bitrate in everything is better. The higher the bitrate, the better the quality. Audio, video, pictures, ...
Just keep in mind that with high bitrate videos, you must have a good processor.
Hope this helps.  \m/

Incredible performance.  I can watch full HD video on my Asus netbook, and the fan doesn't even speed up.
It even goes from windowed to fullscreen instantly.
I think I will buy the legit codec, it's really that good.

just a heads up to everyone with win 7!!!
if you already have some version of haali media splitter installed then remove it before installing this release,because there's this slight possibility of all hell breaking loose [explorer crashing in an endless loop] upon you if you fail to do so :/
